text: The Château d'Heilly is a ruined historic castle in Heilly, Somme, Hauts-de- France, France. ==History== The site has been occupied by a castle since the Middle Ages, but the present château was built in the 18th century.French Ministry of Culture: Château d'Heilly It was redesigned by the architect Pierre Contant d'Ivry in 1840. In the same year, the gate was moved to the Château de Bertangles.French Ministry of Culture: Château de Bertangles It was demolished in 1848, and turned into a quarry. ==Architectural significance== The ruins have been listed as an official historical monument by the French Ministry of Culture since 2009. ==References== Heilly Chateau Heilly
title: Château d'Heilly
